description: CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF FRANK MURPHY, OF MICHIGAN, TO BE ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE UNITED STATES.
CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF HARRY L. HOPKINS, OF NEW YORK, TO BE SECRETARY OF COMMERCE.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 83, AN APPROPRIATION BILL FOR WORK RELIEF, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR RELIEF PURPOSES
CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF FLOYD H. ROBERTS, OF VIRGINIA, TO BE UNITED STATES DISTRICT JUDGE FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF VIRGINIA.
TO AMEND HH.R. 3743, AN APPROPRIATION BILL FOR THE EXECUTIVE OFFICE, BY ELIMINATING THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE GILBERTSVILLE DAM IN THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AUTHORITY.
TO AMEND H.R. 3791, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE NATIONAL DEFENSE, BY RAISING THE LIMIT OF AIRPLANE PRODUCTION FROM 5,500 TO 6,000.
TO PASS H.R. 3791, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE NATIONAL DEFENSE.

TO AMEND H.R. 4425, A BILL TO REORGANIZE EXECUTIVE AGENCIES, BY PROVIDING THAT THE REORGANIZATION SPECIFIED IN THE PLAN SHOULD NOT BECOME EFFECTIVE UNTIL AFTER THE ENACTMENT OF A JOINT RESOLUTION SPECIFICALLY APPROVING SUCH PLAN, AND THAT ANY SUCH JOINT ESOLUTION SHOULD PROVIDE FOR THE APPROVAL OF SUCH PLAN AS A WHOLE, WITHOUT MODIFICATIONS, AND SHOULD CONTAIN NO OTHER PROVISIONS.

TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 4425 PROVIDING THAT THE REORGANIZATION SPECIFIED IN THE PLAN SHOULD NOT BECOME EFFECTIVE UNTIL AFTER THE ENACTMENT OF A JOINT RESOLUTION SPECIFICALLY APPROVING SUCH PLAN, AND THAT AN SUCH JOINT RESOLUTION SHOULD PROVIDE FOR THE APPROVAL OF SUCH A PLAN AS A WHOLE, WITHOUT MODIFICATIONS, AND SHOULD CONTAIN NO OTHER PROVISIONS, WAS AGREED TO
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE SO-CALLED WHEELER AMENDMENT TO H.R. 4425 WAS ADOPTED. SEE ROLL CALLS NO. 1008,1009.

RECONSIDERATION OF AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 4425, PROVIDING THAT THE REORGANIZATION SPECIFIED IN THE PLAN SHOULD NOT BECOME EFFECTIVE UNTIL AFTER THE ENACTMENT OF A JOINT RESOLUTION SPECIFICALLY APPROVING SUCH PLAN, AND THAT ANY SUCH JOINT RESOLUTION SHOULD ROVIDE FOR THE APPROVAL OF SUCH PLAN AS A WHOLE, WITHOUT MODIFICATIONS, AND SHOULD CONTAIN NO OTHER PROVISIONS
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE WHEELER AMENDMENT TO H.R. 4425 WAS DEFEATED. SEE ROLL CALL 1011.
TO AMEND H.R. 4425, BY EXCLUDING THE CIVIL AERONAUTICS AUTHORITY FROM THE NUMBER OF AGENCIES WHICH COULD BE AFFECTED BY AN EXECUTIVE ORDER.
TO PASS H.R. 4425.

TO AMEND S. 572, A BILL RELATING TO THE ACQUISITION OF STRATEGIC AND CRITICAL MATERIALS, BY PROVIDING THAT "IF ANY STRATEGIC OR CRITICAL MATERIALS ARE, IN PURSUANCE OF THIS ACT, PURCHASED FROM ANY FOREIGN GOVERNMENT OR AGENCY THAT IS INDEBTED TO THE UNITD STATES, THE DEPARTMENTS OR OFFICIALS WHO REPRESENT THIS GOVERNMENT IN THE TRANSACTION SHALL ENDEAVOR TO HAVE THE AMOUNT OF SUCH PURCHASE OR PURCHASES CREDITED ON THE INDEBTEDNESS OF SUCH FOREIGN GOVERNMENT OR AGENCY TO THE UNITED STATES INSTEAD OF OBLIG...
TO AMEND S. 572, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE PURCHASE OF CRITICAL AND STRATEGIC MATERIALS FROM $25,000,000 TO $10,000,000.
TO PASS S. 572.
CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF WILLIAM O. DOUGLAS, OF CONNECTICUT, TO BE ASSOCIATE JUSTICE OF THE SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 246, APPROPRIATIONS FOR WORK RELIEF, BY RAISING THE TOTAL APPROPRIATION FOR WORK RELIEF AND RELIEF PURPOSES BY $100,000,000.

TO AMEND H.R. 4852, APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE INTERIOR, BY PROVIDING THAT NO PART OF THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS NATIONAL PARK, N. C. AND TENN. SHOULD BE USED FOR THE PAYMENT OF THE PRESENT SUPERINTENDENT OF THE PARK.

TO PASS S. 2065, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE REGULATION OF THE SALE OF CERTAIN SECURITIES IN INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE AND THROUGH THE MAILS, AND THE REGULATION OF THE TRUST INDENTURES UNDER WHICH THE SAME ARE ISSUED.

TO AMEND H.R. 5269, APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION IN THIS BILL BY THE SUM OF $1,900,000 FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING FUNDS TO BE AVAILABLE FOR EXPENDITURE BY THE SOIL CONSERVA- TION WITH AND IN ASSISTIN THE WORK THAT WAS BEING UNDER- TAKEN BY SOIL-CONSERVATION DISTRICTS.
TO SUSPEND PARAGRAPH 4 OF RULE XVI FOR THE PURPOSE OF ENABLING THE SENATOR FROM ALABAMA TO OFFER AN AMENDMENT TO THE PENDING BILL, H.R. 5269.
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECOMMIT H.R. 5269 WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO THE APPROPRIATIONS COMMITTEE TO ELIMINATE ALL ITEMS IN EXCESS OF BUDGET ESTIMATES OR ITEMS NOT RECOMMENDED BY THE BUDGET.
TO PASS H.R. 5269.
TO PASS S. 110 A BILL FOR THE COMPLETION OF THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE ATLANTIC-GULF SHIP CANAL ACROSS FLORIDA.
TO PASS H.R. 6149 A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE NAVY DEPARTMENT AND THE NAVAL SERVICE FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1940.

TO AMEND S. 2009, A BILL TO AMEND THE INTERSTATE COMMERCE ACT.  THE AMENDMENT PROVIDES  THAT "ALL FORMS OF WATER TRANSPORTATION, EXCEPT JOINT RAIL-AND-WATER RATES, ARE HEREBY EXEMPT AND EXEMPTED FROM THE OPERATIONS OF THIS ACT."

TO AMEND S. 2009, BY REQUIRING THAT "FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS ACT, IT SHALL BE DEEMED TO BE AN UNFAIR OR DECEPTIVE ACT OR PRACTICE IN COMMERCE FOR ANY PERSON, PARTNERSHIP, OR CORPORATION TO SO FIX THE PRICE AT POINT OF DESTINATION OF ANY GOODS OR COMMODIIES TRANSPORTED IN COMMERCE THAT SUCH PRICE INCLUDES A CHARGE FOR TRANSPORTATION, BASED UPON RAILROAD RATES, FOR ANY PART OF THE TRANSPORTATION OF SUCH GOODS OR COMMODITIES WHICH WAS NOT CONDUCTED BY RAILROAD."
TO PASS S. 2009.
TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON INTEROCEANIC CANALS WITH INSTRUCTION, S. 222, A BILL RELATING TO THE CANAL ZONE.
TO DECIDE WHETHER AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2390, A BILL RELATING TO THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS, AMOUNTED TO A REVENUE BILL WHICH MUST ORIGINATE IN HOUSE.

TO AMEND H.R. 5748, THE SECOND LIBERTY BOND ACT, BY LEGALIZED THE CONTRACT MADE BETWEEN THE T. V. A. AND THE COMMONWEALTH AND SOUTHERN UNDER WHICH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY POWER CO., AND ONE OR TWO OTHER SIMILAR CORPORATIONS WERE PURCHASED BY THE T. R. A.
TO AMEND S. 591, A BILL TO AMEND THE U. S. HOUSING ACT OF 1937, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION BY A TOTAL OF $415,000,000 OUT OF A TOTAL APPROPRIATION OF $845,000,000.
TO PASS S. 591, A BILL TO AMEND THE UNITED STATES HOUSING ACT OF 1937.

TO AMEND H.R. 6392, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE STATE DEPARTMENT, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY OF COMMERCE FROM $381,500 TO $606,500 FOR THE PURPOSE OF EMPLOYING EXPERT BUSINESSMEN.
TO AMEND H.R. 6851, THE REVENUE ACT, BY PLACING THE BURDEN OF TAX REVENUE ON THE "PROGRESSIVE" OR "ABILITY TO PAY" FORMULA.  (PRESIDING OFFICER BROKE THE TIE BY VOTING "NAY".)

TO AMEND H.R. 6851, THE REVENUE ACT, BY EXEMPTING FROM FEDERAL MOTOR-FUEL TAX OF 1 CENT PER GALLON MOTOR FUEL CONTAINING 10 PER CENT OR MORE OF ALCOHOL MADE FROM ANY KIND OF FARM PRODUCT PRODUCED IN THE CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES.

TO AMEND H.R. 3325, A BILL RELATING TO THE STABILIZATION OF THE DOLLAR, BY REQUIRING THE GOVERNMENT TO BUY SILVER AT $1.16 PER OUNCE (SILVER WAS THEN SELLING ON THE OPEN-MARKET FOR 40 CENTS AN OUNCE).
TO DECIDE AN APPEAL OF THE CHAIR'S DECISION THAT TWO QUESTIONS ARE INVOLVED IN AN AMENDMENT GIVING THE PRESIDENT THE POWER TO DEVALUATE THE GOLD DOLLAR AND TO FIX THE PRICE OF SILVER.

TO AMEND H.R. 3325, BY PROVIDING THAT "THE POWERS OF THE PRESIDENT SPECIFIED IN THIS PARAGRAPH SHALL BE DEEMED TO BE SEPARATE, DISTINCT, AND CONTINUING POWERS, AND MAY BE EXERCISED BY HIM, FROM TIME TO TIME, SEVERALLY OR TOGETHER, WHENEVER AND AS THE EXPESSED OBJECTS OF THIS SECTION IN HIS JUDGMENT MAY REQUIRE; EXCEPT THAT THE POWERS SO SPECIFIED WHICH RELATE TO THE ALTERATION OF THE WEIGHT OF THE DOLLAR AND SUBSIDIARY COINS SHALL EXPIRE JUNE 30, 1939, AND THE POWERS SO SPECIFIED WHICH RELATE TO THE ISSU...
TO AMEND H.R. 3325, BY FIXING THE PRICE OF SILVER AND REQUIRING GOVERNMENT PURCHASE OF SILVER.

TO AMEND H.R. 3325, BY PROVIDING THAT IT IS "THE POLICY OF THE UNITED STATES THAT THE PRICE LEVEL AS SHOWN BY THE BUREAU OF LABOR STATISTICS SHALL BE ADJUSTED TO 100, AND IT SHALL BE THE DUTY OF THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE SYSTEM, THE SC

TO AMEND H.R. 3325, BY PROVIDING THAT "THE SUM OF $1.5 BILLION HERETOFORE APPROPRIATED AND COVERED INTO A STABILIZATION FUND AS PROVIDED BY PUBLIC LAW NO. 87 ... IS HEREBY REAPPROPRIATED AND COVERED INTO THE GENERAL FUND OF THE TREASURY, AND PARAGRAPH (C OF THE GOLD RESERVE ACT ..
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 326, A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR WORK RELIEF AND RELIEF, BY REQUIRING THAT THE STATES MAKE A 25 PER CENT CONTRIBUTION TO ALL WORK-RELIEF PROJECTS.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 326, BY ESTABLISHING A MINIMUM W.P.A. PROGRAM AUTHORIZING THE EXPENDITURE OF $400,000,000 FOR PUBLIC-SPONSORED PROJECTS AND $100,000,000 FOR WHOLLY FEDERAL PROJECTS.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 326, BY ESTABLISHING A MINIMUM W.P.A. PROGRAM AUTHORIZING THE EXPENDITURE OF $200,000,000 FOR PUBLIC-SPONSORED PROJECTS AND $50,000,000 FOR WHOLLY FEDERAL PROJECTS.  THE AMENDMENT ALSO STIPULATED THAT THE PROPORTION OF PUBLIC-WORKS COSTTO BE BORNE BY THE MUNICIPALITIES, CITIES, AND OTHER PUBLIC BODIES WOULD BE 70 PER CENT INSTEAD OF THE 55 PER CENT UNDER THE PROPOSED PLAN.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 326, BY REQUIRING THAT "THE ADMINISTRATOR SHALL FURNISH UPON REQUEST TO ANY MEMBER OF CONGRESS THE NAMES, ADDRESSES, POSITIONS, AND SALARIES OF ALL EMPLOYEES OF THE WORKS PROGRESS ADMINISTRATION WHOSE WAGE OR PAY IS A THOUSAND OR MORE DLLARS ANNUALLY."
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 326, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL PERSONS GIVEN EMPLOYMENT BY THE W.P.A. OR RELEASED BY THAT AUTHORITY SHOULD BE DONE SO "ON THE BASIS OF RELATIVE NEEDS."
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 326, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE FARM SECURITY ADMINISTRATION FROM $123,000,000 TO $153,000,000.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 326 BY PROVIDING THAT "LOANS MAY ALSO BE MADE UNDER THIS TITLE TO ENABLE THE BORROWER TO REFINANCE AN EXISTING MORTGAGE OR MORTGAGES ON A FARM."
TO PASS H.J.RES. 326.
CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF ARCHIBALD MACLEISH TO BE LIBRARIAN OF CONGRESS.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 3325, A BILL EXTENDING THE TIME WITHIN WHICH THE POWERS RELATING TO THE STABLIZA- TION AND ALTERATION OF THE WEIGHT OF THE DOLLAR MAY BE EXERCISED.

CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6577, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA TAXATION BILL, TO INSIST ON SENATE AMENDMENTS AND AGREE TO THE FURTHER CONFERENCE REQUESTED BY THE HOUSE, AND THAT THE CHAIR APPOINT THE SENATE CONFEREES ON FOR THE FURTHER CONFERENCE.
TO REFER S. 2765, AMENDMENT OF EMERGENCY RELIEF APPROPRIA- TION ACT, TO THE COMMITTEE ON EDUCATION AND LABOR.

TO AMEND H.R. 6635, A BILL AMENDING THE SOCIAL SECURITY ACT, BY PROVIDING THAT EACH STATE PLAN WOULD HAVE TO PROVIDE, AS A CONDITION OF SECURING APPROVAL BY THE BOARD, THAT THE PERSONNEL SELECTED WITHIN THE STATE TO ADMINISTER THE LAW SHOULD BE SELECTED N CIVIL-SERVICE OR MERIT BASIS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6635, BY INCREASING THE COVERAGE OF THE SOCIAL SECURITY ACT INVOLVING THE APPROPRIATION OF $600,000,000.

TO AMEND H.R. 6635, BY PROVIDING INCREASED AUTHORIZATIONS FOR APPROPRIATIONS FOR MATERNAL AND CHILD HEALTH, VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION, AND PUBLIC HEALTH AS AUTHORIZED IN THE ORIGINAL SOCIAL SECURITY ACT.

TO AMEND H.R. 6635, BY REQUIRING THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO CONTRIBUTE $2 TO THE STATE'S $1 UP TO $15.  ABOVE $15 THERE WOULD BE AN EQUAL CONTRIBUTION.  THE PURPOSE OF THE AMENDMENT WAS TO PROVIDE FEDERAL BENEFITS, OR AT LEAST TO OFFER ENCOURAGEMENT TO TH WEAKER AND POORER STATES, IN ORDER THAT THEY COULD MAKE ADEQUATE CONTRIBUTIONS FOR OLD-AGE ASSISTANCE.

TO AMEND H.R. 6635, BY REPEALING THE REQUIREMENT OF STATE CONTRIBUTION FOR AID TO NEEDY OLD PEOPLE, AND SUBSTITUTE THEREFOR AN OUTRIGHT FEDERAL PENSION OF $40 A MONTH TO EVERY CITIZEN 60 YEARS OF AGE OR MORE WHO IS NOT GAINFULLY EMPLOYED.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 6635, TO THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE.
TO AMEND H.R. 6635, BY REQUIRING THE STATES AFTER JANUARY 1, 1941, TO PAY AT LEAST $10 PER MONTH TO THE RECIPIENTS OF OLD AGE PENSIONS.
TO PASS H.R. 6635.
TO PASS S. 280, A BILL TO PROHIBIT AND TO PREVENT THE TRADE PRACTICES KNOWN AS COMPULSORY BLOCK BOOKING AND BLIND SELLING IN THE LEASING OF MOTION-PICTURE FILMS IN INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE.
TO PASS S. 162, A BILL TO PROTECT PRODUCERS, MANUFACTURERS, DISTRIBUTORS, AND CONSUMERS FROM THE UNREVEALED PRESENCE OF SUBSTITUTES AND MIXTURES IN MANUFACTURED WOOL PRODUCTS.
TO AMEND EXECUTIVE B, A GENERAL TREATY WITH PANAMA, BY STIPULATING THAT IN THE EVENT OF EMERGENCY CONDITIONS THE UNITED STATES COULD INTERVENE WITHOUT CONSULTATION WITH THE PANAMANIAN GOVERNMENT.
RATIFICATION OF EXECUTIVE B, A GENERAL TREATY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA.
TO RECOMMIT S. 2185, A BILL TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL DISTRICT AND CIRCUIT JUDGES, TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY.
TO AMEND S. 2864, A PROGRAM FOR FINANCING RECOVERABLE EXPENDITURES, BY ELIMINATING $500,000,000 FROM THE BILL TO BE MADE ABAILABLE FOR PUBLIC ROADS.
TO AMEND S. 2864, BY MAKING AN ADDITIONAL APPROPRIATION FOR WORK-RELIEF AND TRANSFERING MOST OF THE MONEY (EXCEPT FOR $350,000,000) FROM P.W.A. ADMINISTRATION.
TO AMEND S. 2864, BY APPROPRIATING AN ADDITIONAL $250,000,000 TO BEGIN PROJECTS WHICH HAD BEEN APPROVED BY THE P.W.A. BUT FOR WHICH THERE WAS NO MONEY AVAILABLE.

TO AMEND S. 2864, BY AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF AGRICUL- TURE TO USE FUNDS OF THE FEDERAL FARM MORTGAGE CORPORATION TO REFINANCE FARM MORTGAGES ON WHICH THE PAYMENTS PERIODICALLY DUE EXCEED THE NORMAL FARM INCOME AVAILABLE FOR DEBT SERVICE.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2864, ELIMINATED $500,000,000 FROM THE BILL FOR PUBLIC ROADS PURPOSES, WAS DEFEATED.
TO AMEND S. 2864, BY ELIMINATING $500,000,000 DESIGNED FOR PUBLIC ROADS PURPOSES, FROM THE BILL.
TO AMEND S. 2864, BY PROVIDING THAT THE AREA PREVAILING WAGE CONTINUE TO BE PAID IN W.P.A. WORK-RELIEF JOBS.

TO AMEND S. 2864, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION THAT PERSONS EMPLOYED EIGHTEEN MONTHS BY THE W.P.A. MUST BE RELEASED AND PROVIDING THAT SUCH A RELEASE WOULD OCCUR ONLY IF THE PERSON EFFECTED DID NOT SEEK OTHER EMPLOYMENT.
TO AMEND S. 2864, BY REPEALING ALL PROVISIONS OF EXISTING STATUTES WHICH PERMIT OR COMPEL THE GOVERNMENT TO BY FOREIGN SILVER.

TO AMEND S. 2864 BY STRIKING FROM THE BILL A SECTION AUTHORIZING THE RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORPORATION TO BUY EQUIPMENT FOR A RAILROAD.  THE R.F.C. WOULD THEN ACCEPT FROM THE RAILROAD ITS OLD EQUIPMENT AS PART OF THE PURCHASE PRICE, AND WOULD THEN LEND HE RAILROAD THE BALANCE OF THE MONEY NEEDED.

TO AMEND S. 2864 BY PROVIDING THAT "NO FUNDS SHALL BE MADE AVAILABLE UNDER THIS SUBSECTION TO ANY PUBLIC BODY, OR TO ANY CORPORATION, FOR USE BY ANY SUCH AGENCY OR CORPORATION TO ESTABLISH, OR EXPAND ANY COMMERCIAL ENTERPRISE WHICH IS OR WILL BE AS A RESLT OF SUCH LOAN IN COMPETITION WITH ANY EXISTING COMMERCIAL ENTERPRISE, PROVIDED THE LIMITATION HEREIN SHALL NOT APPLY TO ANY SUCH LOAN FOR PUBLIC HOSPITAL, COLLEGE, OR UNIVERSITY."

TO AMEND S. 2864 BY PROVIDING "THAT LOANS UNDER THIS SUBSECTION SHALL BE SO ADMINITSTERED AS NOT TO PROMOTE ANY ANY UNDERTAKING IN A FIELD NOW ADEQUATELY SUPPLIED BY EXISTING COMPETITIVE PRIVATE ENTERPRISE OR BY EXISTING NONCOMPETITIVE PRIVATE ENTERPRISEAT REASONABLE RATES OR PRICES, UNLESS IN THE LATTER CASE A REASONABLE OFFER IS MADE TO ACQUIRE THE FACILITIES OF SUCH NONCOMPETITIVE ENTERPRISE AND SUCH OFFER HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED, AND A FINDING AS TO BOTH THE REASONABLENESS OF SAID OFFER AND ALSO AS TO ...

TO AMEND S. 2864, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE EXPORT-IMPORT BANK BY $25,000, AND PROVIDING "THAT NO LOAN SHALL BE MADE UNDER THIS SECTION FOR ANY PURPOSE OTHER THAN FACILITATING TRADE BY WAY OF INCREASING EXPORTS FROM THE UNITED STATES TO FOREIN MARKETS: PROVIDED FURTHER, THAT ALL FUNDS MADE AVAILABLE UNDER THIS SECTION SHALL BE EXPENDED IN THE UNITED STATES."
TO AMEND S. 2864 BY REQUIRING NO MONEY RECEIVED BY THE TREASURY, COULD BE EXPENDED BY THE US TREASURY WITHOUT A CONGRESSIONAL APPROPRIATION.
TO AMEND S. 2864, BY REQUIRING THAT ALL NOTES, AND OTHER OBLIGATIONS ISSUED TO CARRY OUT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT SHOULD BE SUBJECT TO TAXATION.
TO PASS S. 2864.

TO AMEND H.R. 7462, THIRD DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATION BILL, BY ENABLING "THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY, ON BEHALF OF THE UNITED STATES, TO RESTORE THE AMOUNT OF THE CAPITAL IMPAIRMENT OF THE COMMODITY CREDIT CORPORATION AS OF MARCH 31, 1939, BY CONTRIBUTIONTO THE CORPORATION AS PROVIDED BY THE ACT APPROVED MARCH 8, 1938 FISCAL YEAR 1940, $119,599,918.05."
TO SUSPEND THE RULES TO ALLOW AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7462, WHICH WOULD MAINTAIN THE PREVAILING WAGE RULE ON WORK-RELIEF PROJECTS.
TO SUSPEND PARAGRAPH 4 OF RULE XVI SO THAT AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7462, MAINTAING THE PREVAILING WAGE RULE ON WORK-RELIEF PROJECTS COULD BE MADE.

TO SUSPEND PARAGRAPH 4 OF RULE XVI SO THAT AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7462, COULD BE MADE, STIPULATING THAT PERSONS WOULD NOT BE DISCHARGED FROM WORK-RELIEF AFTER EIGHTEEN MONTHS OF THEY HAD MADE AN EFFORT TO OBTAIN OTHER EMPLOYMENT.

TO SUSPEND PARAGRAPH 4 OF RULE XVI SO THAT AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7462, COULD BE MADE, AUTHORIZING THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE TO USE THE FUNDS OF THE FEDERAL FARM MORTGAGE CORPORATION TO LIMIT FARM MORTGAGE FORECLOSURES.
TO SUSPEND PARAGRAPH 4 OF RULE XVI SO THAT AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 7462 COULD BE MADE, RESTORING THE FEDERAL THEATER PROJECT DROPPED IN THE EMERGENCY RELIEF APPROPRIATION ACT OF 1939.

TO PASS S.RES. 126, INCREASING THE LIMIT OF EXPENDITURES FOR THE INVESTIGATION OF VIOLATIONS OF THE RIGHT OF FREE SPEECH AND ASSEMBLY AND INTERFERENCE WITH THE RIGHT OF LABOR TO ORGANIZE AND BARGAIN COLLECTIVELY.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 6635, AMENDMENTS OF SOCIAL SECURITY ACT.

TO DECIDE A POINT OF ORDER, REGARDING A VIOLATION OF RULE XIX, MAKING A DIRECT AND POSITIVE CHARGE OF IMPROPER CONDUCT AGAINST MEMBERS OF THE UNITED STATES SENATE, THE POINT OF ORDER WAS RAISED WITH RESPECT TO A SPEECH BY SEN. PEPPER MADE IN DEFENSE OF TE LABOR POLICIES OF THE PRESIDENT.
TO RECOMMIT H.J.RES. 306, NEUTRALITY ACT OF 1939, TO THE COMMITTEE ON FOREIGN RELATIONS WITH INSTRUCTIONS.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, PROVIDING THAT "SO LONG AS THE PRESENT WAR BETWEEN GREAT BRITAIN, FRANCE, GERMANY, AND OTHER COUNTRIES CONTINUES, ALL WATERS WITHIN 300 MILES OF THE CONTINENT OF EUROPE, OF GREAT BRITAIN, OF IRELAND, ARE HEREBY DECLARED TO BE A COMAT AREA, WITH THE SAME LEGAL EFFECT AS IF THE PRESIDENT HAD PROCLAIMED SUCH WATERS A COMBAT AREA."

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY REQUIRING THAT "NO LICENSE SHALL BE ISSUED BY SAID BOARD FOR THE EXPORT OF AIRCRAFT OF ANY TYPE, WHETHER ASSEMBLED OR UNASSEMBLED, AND ALL ENGINES AND PARTS THEREOF AS DESCRIBED IN CATEGORY III AND CATEGORY V OF PRESIDENTIAL PROLAMATION NO
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY REQUIRING THAT TWO MEMBERS OF THE SENATE AND TWO MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE BE APPOINTED TO THE NATIONAL MUNITIONS CONTROL BOARD.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY REDUCING THE PRESIDENT'S DISCRETION IN DECIDING WHEN A STATE OF WAR BETWEEN TWO FOREIGN STATES EXISTED.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY ELIMINATING THE RIGHT OF CONGRESS BY CONCURRENT RESOLUTION TO DECLARE THAT A STATE OF WAR EXISTED BETWEEN TWO FOREIGN STATES.
TO EMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY ESTABLISHING AN EXPORT CONTROL BOARD TO CONTROL THE SHIPMENTS OF FARM EXPORTS TO BELLIGERENTS.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY PHOHIBITING THE ISSUE OF ANY LICENSE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES FOR THE EXPORT OF LIVENS PROJECTORS AND FLAME THROWERS; MUSTARD GAS, PHOSGENE, OR ANY OF THE POISON GASES LISTED IN CATEGORY VI, PROCLAMATION 2237, PROMULGATED BY THE RESIDENT MAY 1, 1937."
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY PREVENTING ANYONE IN THE U.S. FROM TRADING IN IMPLEMENTS OF WAR OF ALL KINDS, WHETHER IN PEACE OR WARTIME.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY PROVIDING THAT "SUBSECTION (A) OF SECTION 10 OF THE GOLD RESERVE ACT OF 1934, AS AMENDED, BY INSERTING THEREIN, IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE FIRST SENTENCE THEREOF, THE FOLLOWING NEW SENTENCE:  THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY SHALL NOT A ANY TIME HOLD CURRENCY, OR BILLS OF EXCHANGE PAYABLE IN THE CURRENCY, OF ANY STATE NAMED IN ANY CURRENTLY EFFECTIVE PROCLAMATION ISSUED UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF SECTION 1 (A) OF THE NEUTRALITY ACT OF 1939, FOR WHICH HE HAS EXPENDED MORE THAN $20,000,000 FR...

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY PROHIBITING "THE GOVERNMENT OF THE UNITED STATES OR ANY AGENCY THEREOF FROM MAKING ANY LOANS DESIGNED TO FINANCE OR ASSIST THE EXPORT OF GOODS, MATERIALS, OR MERCHANDISE OF ANY KIND TO THE TERRITORY OF ANY FOREIGN GOVERNMENT NAMD IN ANY CURRENTLY EFFECTIVE PROCLAMATION ISSUED UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF SECTION 1 (A) OF THE NEUTRALITY ACT OF 1939."

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY PROVIDING THAT "DURING ANY WAR IN WHICH THE U.S. IS NEUTRAL IT SHALL BE UNLAWFUL FOR THE ARMED MERCHANT VESSELS OF A BELLIGERENT FOREIGN STATE TO ENTER A PORT OR THE TERRITORIAL WATERS OF THE U.S. OR DEPART THEREFROM EXCEPT UNDE THE SAME CONDITIONS AS OTHER NAVAL SURFACE VESSELS OF BELLIGERENT FOREIGN STATES
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH SENATOR CLARK'S AMENDMENT TO H.J.RES. 306 WAS DEFEATED.  (SEE ROLL CALL 2012)
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY RESTRAINING SHIPMENTS OF ARMS TO BELLIGERENTS THROUGH NEUTRALS.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY AUTHORIZING CONGRESS, IF IT SO DESIRED, TO SET UP MACHINERY TO MAKE A NATION-WIDE REFERENDUM ON THE QUESTION OF WHETHER OR NOT THE U.S. SHOULD ENTER AN OVERSEAS WAR.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 306, BY REQUIRING THAT UNDER THE "CASH AND CARRY" PROVISION OF THE LAW THAT THE ARTICLES OR MATERIALS PURCHASED BE "PAID FOR IN FULL IN LAWFUL MONEY OF THE UNITED STATES."
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 360, BY ELIMINATING THE CASH AND CARRY PROVISION OF THE ARMS EMBARGO.
TO PASS H.J.RES. 306.
TO AGREE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.J.RES. 306.
TO PASS S.CON.RES. 31, PROVIDING THAT CONGRESS ADJOURN NOVEMBER 3, 1939, SINE DIE.

TO AMEND H.R. 7805, A BILL MAKING SUPPLEMENTAL MILITARY AND NAVAL APPROPRIATIONS, BY STRIKING THE WORDS "FOR THE ACQUISTITION OF APPROXIMATELY 800 ACRES IN PUERTO RICO FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A GENERAL DEPOT AND CANTONMENT AREA AND THE ENLARGEMENT OF CAP BUCHANAN.

TO AMEND H.R. 7922, INDEPENDENT OFFICES APPROPRIATIONS 1941, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE NATIONAL RESOURCES PLANNING BOARD BY APPROXIMATELY $650,000 OUT OF AN ORIGINAL APPROPRIATION OF $750,000.
TO AMEND H.R. 7922, BY APPROPRIATING $750,000 FOR A NEWLY CREATED NATIONAL RESOURCES PLANNING BOARD.  THIS BOARD REPLACED THE FEDERAL EMPLOYMENT STABILIZATION BOARD.
TO AMEND H.R. 7922, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE CIVIL AERONAUTICS AUTHORITY FROM $1,659,191 TO $1,543,932. (THE CHAIR BROKE THE TIE BY VOTING "YES.")
TO AMEND H.R. 7922 BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR CONTRACT STENOGRAPHIC REPORTING SERVICES, FEES AND MILEAGE OF WITNESSES OF THE CIVIL AERONAUTICS AUTHORITY FROM $519,222 TO $469,222.

TO AMEND H.R. 7922, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR MAINTENANCE AND OPERATION OF AIR-NAVIGATION FACILITIES FROM $12,000,000 TO $11,000,000.  THIS MONEY WAS DESIGNED PRIMARILY FOR THE INSTALLATION OF AIR SAFETY DEVICES.

TO AMEND H.R. 7922, BY STRIKING THE FOLLOWING PROVISION OF AN APPROPRIATION FOR THE VETERAN'S ADMINISTRATION "NO PART OF THIS APPROPRIATION SHALL BE EXPENDED FOR THE PURCHASE OF OLEOMARGARINE OR BUTTER SUBSTITUTES EXCEPT FOR COOKING PURPOSES."
TO AMEND H.R. 7922, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE CONSTRUCTION FUND OF T. V. A. FROM $40,000,000 TO $35,000,000.
TO PASS S.RES. 234 A RESOLUTION TO EXPEDITE THE SALE OF BONDS AND SECURITIES IN THE COUNTRY BY FINLAND.
TO AMEND S. 3069, LOANS TO FINLAND, BY REDUCING AN AUTHO- RIZED R. F. C. LOAN TO FINLAND FROM $200,000,000 TO $150,000,000.
TO PASS S. 3069, A BILL TO PROVIDE CERTAIN LOANS TO THE REPUBLIC OF FINLAND BY THE RECONSTRUCTION FINANCE CORPORATION.

TO AMEND H.R. 8068, APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE TREASURY AND POST OFFICE DEPARTMENTS, BY PROVIDING "THAT NO PART OF THE MONEY APPROPRIATED UNDER THIS ITEM SHALL BE EXPENDED FOR TRANSPORTATION OF FOREIGN MAILS BY ANY AIRCRAFT LANDING ON THE ISLAND OF BERMUDA (XCEPT IN THE CASE OF FORCED LANDINGS) WHILE A PROCLAMATION ISSUED UNDER AUTHORITY OF SECTION 1 (A) OF THE NEUTRALITY ACT OF 1939, AND NAMING THE UNITED KINGDOM, IS IN EFFECT AND WHILE THE GOVERNMENT OF THE UNITED KINGDOM ASSERTS ANY ALLEGED RIGHT TO STOP ...

TO AMEND H.R. 8319, APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF STATE, COMMERCE, JUSTICE, AND FOR THE JUDICIARY, BY STRIKING "BUREAU OF INTERPARLIAMENTARY UNION FOR PROMOTION OF INTERNATIONAL ARBITRATION, $20,000, INCLUDING NOT TO EXCEED $10,000 FOR THE EXPENSS OF THE AMERICAN GROUP OF THE INTERPARLIAMENTARY UNION, INCLUDING PERSONAL SERVICES IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AND ELSEWHERE, AND OTHER NECESSARY EXPENSES TO BE DISBURSED ON VOUCHERS APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT AND EXECUTIVE SECRETARY OF THE AMERICAN GROU...

TO AMEND H.R. 8319 APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE DEPARTMENTS OF STATE, COMMERCE, JUSTICE, AND FOR THE JUDICIARY, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE BY $162,000.  THIS MONEY WAS TO BE USED FOR THE PERSONAL SERVICES OF EXPERTS AND SPECALISTS IN THE DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE
TO AMEND S. 3046, EXTENSION OF ANTIPERNICIOUS POLITICAL ACTIVITIES ACT, BY REPEALING SOME SECTIONS OF THE HATCH ACT OF 1939 PERTAINING TO THE POLITICAL ACTIVITIES OF MINOR FEDERAL EMPLOYEES.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046, BY PROVIDING THE RIGHT OF APPEAL TO THE COURTS AFTER A MAN WHO HAD A HEARING BEFORE THE CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION HAD BEEN CISCHARGED.

TO AMEND S. 3046, BY PROHIBITING ANY EMPLOYEE, OFFICER IN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, OR ANY AGENCY OR DEPARTMENT THEREOF, FROM TAKING ANY ACTIVE PART IN POLITICAL MANAGEMENT OR IN POLITICAL CAMPAIGNS.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046 BY, IN EFFECT, UNDERMINING THE BILL. PROPONENTS OF THE AMENDMENT ARGUED THAT THE BILL WAS AN INVASION OF STATES RIGHTS.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO ADJOURN THE SENATE, IN LIEU OF A MOTION TO CONSIDER EXECUTIVE BUSINESS.  BOTH MOTIONS WERE MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 3046.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046, BY LIMITING THE POLITICAL ACTIVITIES OF OFFICERS OF CORPORATIONS BENEFITING IN ANY MANNER FROM TARIFFS, EXCISE TAXES, OR IMPORT QUOTAS; OFFICERS OF CORPORATIONS OBTAINING LOANS FROM THE R. F. C. OR ANY OTHER FEDERAL AGENCY; STOCKHOLDERSOR OFFICERS OF CORPORATIONS WITH A TAX REFUND PENDING BEFORE THE CLAIMS COMMITTEE, ETC.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO PROCEED TO THE CONSIDERATION OF THE AGRICULTURAL APPROPRIATION BILL, MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 3046.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046, BY BRINGING ABOUT COOPERATION BETWEEN STATE LAWS AND FEDERAL LAWS INSTEAD OF COERCION UNDER FEDERAL LAW AS WAS THE CASE UNDER THE ORIGINAL HATCH ACT.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046, BY LIMITING THE POLITICAL CONTRIBUTIONS OF INDIVIDUALS AND OFFICERS OF CORPORATIONS TO $1,000.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046, BY STRIKING FROM THE PROVISIONS OF THE BILL THE AUTHORITY OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO ATTEMPT TO CURTAIL THE ACTIVITY OF INDIVIDUAL EMPLOYEES OF STATE AGENCIES WHO DECIDE UPON THEIR OWN INITIATIVE TO PARTICIPATE IN A POLITICAL CAMPAIGN.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046 BY LIMITING THE POLITICAL CONTRIBUTIONS OF INDIVIDUALS AND OFFICERS OF CORPORATIONS TO $5,000.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO TABLE A MOTION BY SENATOR BANKHEAD TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH HIS AMENDMENT TO S. 3046, LIMITING CAMPAIGN CONTRIBUTIONS TO $5,000 WAS AGREED TO.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046 BY PLACING THE SAME RESTRICTIONS ON THOSE INDIVIDUALS SEEKING OFFICE AS THE RESTRICTIONS PLACED ON OFFICE-HOLDERS.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046 BY PLACING RESTRICTIONS ON THE POLITICAL ACTIVITIES OF STATE EMPLOYEES SIMILAR TO THOSE INVOKED AGAINST FEDERAL EMPLOYEES.  THE AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT IF THE PROVISIONS OF THE AMENDMENT ARE VIOLATED THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT MAY WITHHOLD FOM THE PARTICULAR STATE WHATEVER PART OF THE FUNDS BEING GRANTED OR LOANED TO THE PARTICULAR ACTIVITY AS MAY BE NECESSARY.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO RECOMMIT S. 3046 TO THE COMMITTEE ON PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046 BY PRESCRIBING WITHIN THE ACT THE PROHIBI- TIONS AGAINST EMPLOYEES IN THE CLASSIFIED CIVIL SERVICE AS TO POLITICAL ACTIVITIES RATHER THAN DELEGATING THE AUTHOR- ITY TO THE UNITED STATES CIVIL SERVICE COMMISSION TO DETERMINE PROHIBITED PRCTICES.
Issue2: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046 BY REQUIRING THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT TO CONTRIBUTE OVER HALF OF THE MONEY FOR STATE, COUNTY, OR MUNICIPAL PROJECTS BEFORE THE ACT WOULD COME INTO EFFECT.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046 BY PROVIDING THAT AS OF THE DATE OF THE PASSAGE OF THE ACT THAT ALL FEDERAL EMPLOYEES AFFECTED BY THE SO-CALLED HATCH ACT WOULD ENJOY ALL THE RIGHTS, PRIVILEGES, AND SAFEGUARDS OF THE CIVIL SERVICE.
Issue2: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AMEND S. 3046 BY INSURING THE RIGHTS OF THE INDIVIDUALS AFFECTED BY THE ACT TO EXPRESS THEIR OPINIONS ON ALL POLITICAL SUBJECTS.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO PASS S. 3046.
Issue1: Campaign Contributions, Lobbying/House Ethics Campaign Laws

description: TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H. R. 8641, FIRST DEFICIENCY APPROPRIATION.
TO AMEND H.R. 8202, AGRICULTURAL APPROPRIATIONS, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FROM $212,000,000 TO $607,000,000 SO AS TO PROVIDE FULL PARITY PRICES TO FARMERS.
TO AMEND H.R. 8202, BY PROVIDING AN APPROPRIATION OF $212,000,000 FOR PARITY PAYMENTS TO PRODUCERS OF WHEAT, COTTON, CORN, RICE AND TOBACCO.
TO UPHOLD A DECISION BY THE PRESIDING OFFICER OF THE SENATE, THE QUESTION WAS WHETHER OR NOT AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8202 OFFERRED BY SENATOR LA FOLLETTE VIOLATED THE RULES OF THE SENATE.
TO AMEND H.R. 8202, BY REQUIRING THAT 85 PER CENT OF THE APPROPRIATION SET ASIDE FOR THE REMOVAL OF SURPLUS AGRICULTURAL COMMODITIES SHOULD BE DEVOTED TO THE STAMP PLAN.
TO SUSPEND A SENATE RULE SO THAT AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 8202 COULD BE INTRODUCED WHICH WOULD HAVE COMPENSATED LOUISIANA AND FLORIDA SUGARCANE PLANTERS FOR OVER PLANTING.

TO AMEND H.R. 8202, BY ADDING THE STIPULATION:  "THAT NO PART OF THE AMOUNT HEREIN APPROPRIATED SHALL BE AVAILABLE FOR MAKING TOTAL CONDITIONAL PAYMENTS IN EXCESS OF $5,000 TO ANY ONE PERSON, FIRM, PARTNERSHIP, OR CORPORATION IN CONNECTION WITH THE 1940 UGAR PROGRAM."

TO AMEND H.R. 8202, BY ADDING THE STIPULATION:  "THAT NO PART OF THE AMOUNT HEREIN APPROPRIATED SHALL BE AVAILABLE FOR MAKING TOTAL CONDITIONAL PAYMENTS IN EXCESS OF $50,000 TO ANY ONE PERSON, FIRM, PARTNERSHIP, OR CORPORATION IN CONNECTION WITH THE 1940SUGAR PROGRAM."

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407, EXTENSION OF RECIPROCAL TRADE AGREEMENTS ACT, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING PROVISIONS: "NO FOREIGN TRADE AGREEMENT HEREAFTER ENTERED INTO UNDER SECTION 1 OF THIS ACT SHALL TAKE EFFECT UNTIL THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES SHALL HAVE ADVSED AND CONSENTED TO ITS RATIFICATION, TWO-THIRDS OF THE SENATORS PRESENT CONCURRING."
TO THE TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE AMENDMENT TO H.J.RES. 407 OFFERED BY SENATOR PITTMAN WHICH WAS REJECTED. SEE ROLL CALL 3042.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 BY PREVENTING THE REVOCATION OF EXCISE TAXES IN CONIUNCTION WITH RECIPROCAL TRADE AGREEMENT.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 BY CREATING AN EXPORT-IMPORT CONTROL BOARD TO REGULATE FOREIGN TRADE WITH BOTH BELLIGERENTS AND NEUTRALS.

TO AMEND J.J.RES. 407, BY CHANGING THE PROCEDURE BY WHICH HEARINGS ARE HELD ON TRADE AGREEMENTS UNDER THE ACT. THE AMENDMENT WOULD PROVIDE THAT THESE HEARINGS WOULD BE HELD AFTER THE TERMS OF THE AGREEMENT HAD BEEN NEGOTIATED RATHER THAN BEFORE.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 BY PROVIDING THE "FOREIGN-TRADE AGREEMENT HEREAFTER ENTERED INTO UNDER THE AUTHORITY DELEGATED TO THE PRESIDENT BY SUCH SECTION 350, AS AMENDED, NO AMENDATORY OR SUPPLEMENTARY AGREEMENT HEREAFTER ENTERED INTO UNDER SUCH SECTION, ANDNO DUTIES AND OTHER IMPORT RESTRICTIONS SPECIFIED IN A PROCLAMATION ISSUED BY THE PRESIDENT TO CARRY OUT ANY SUCH FOREIGN-TRADE AGREEMENT OR ANY SUCH AMENDATORY OR SUPPLEMENTARY AGREEMENT, SHALL TAKE EFFECT UNTIL THE CONGRESS BY LAW HAS SPECIFICALLY APPRO...

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 BY ADDING THE PROVISION THAT "NO FOREIGN TRADE AGREEMENT HEREAFTER ENTERED INTO UNDER SECTION 1 OF THIS ACT SHALL TAKE OFFECT UNTIL SUCH AGREEMENT SHALL HAVE BEEN APPROVED BY THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES."

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING "PROVIDED, THAT NO COMMODITY OR ARTICLE SHALL BE INCLUDED IN ANY FOREIGN-TRADE AGREEMENT ENTERED INTO WHICH PERMITS THE ENTRY INTO AMERICAN MARKETS OF PRODUCTS OF WORKERS, FARMERS, OR MINERS OF FOREIGN COUNTRES AT TOTAL LANDED COSTS, ALL TARIFF DUTIES PAID, WHICH TOTAL COSTS ARE LESS THAN THE COST OF PRODUCTION OR WHOLESALE SELLING PRICE OF COMPETITIVE PRODUCTS OF AMERICAN WORKERS, MINERS, OR FARMERS WHERE SUCH AMERICAN PRODUCTS ARE COMMERCIALLY AVAILABLE."

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 BY PROVIDING THAT BEFORE ANY TREATY SHALL GO INTO EFFECT IT SHALL BE REFERRED TO THE TARIFF COMMISSION, WHICH SHALL HOLD PUBLIC HEARINGS, AND NO RATE SHALL GO INTO EFFECT UNTIL THE TARIFF COMMISSION HAS CERTIFIED TO THE PRESIDENT THT THE RATE IS SUFFICIENT TO EQUALIZE THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE COST OF PRODUCTION IN THE UNITED STATES AND THE DELIVERED COST OF THE COMPETING ARTICLE COMING IN FROM ABROAD.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 CLARIFYING AND EXPANDING THE TERM "AGRICULTURAL PRODUCTS" AS SPECIFIED IN THE TRADE AGREEMENTS IN THE BILL.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 BY LIMITING THE TRADE AGREEMENTS TO ONE YEAR RATHER THAN THREE AS PROVIDED IN THE BILL.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 BY PREVENTING THE LOWERING OF THE TARIFF ON SUGAR.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 407 BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING "ANY FOREIGN TRADE AGREEMENT HERETOFORE ENTERED INTO UNDER SUCH SECTION 350 WHICH IS APPLICABLE WITH RESPECT TO MANGANESE ORE SHALL BE TERMINATED AT THE EARLIEST DATE POSSIBLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TERMS OF UCH AGREEMENT, WITH A VIEW TOWARD MODIFYING OR RENEWING SUCH AGREEMENT IN SUCH A MANNER THAT THE DUTIES AND OTHER IMPORT RESTRICTIONS APPLICABLE WITH RESPECT TO MANGANESE ORE WILL BE THOSE SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED FOR IN TITLE 1 OF THE TARIFF ACT OF 1930."
TO PASS H.J.RES. 407.

TO PASS S.RES. 257, A RESOLUTION TO REFER THE BILL S. 2585, ENTITLED "A BILL TO REIMBURSE THE COTTON COOPERATIVE ASSO- CIATIONS FOR LOSSES OCCASIONED BY THE FEDERAL FARM BOARD'S STABILIZATION OPERATIONS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES," TO THE COURT OF CLAIMS, I PURSUANCE OF THE PROVISIONS OF AN ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT TO CODIFY, REVISE, AND AMEND THE LAWS RELATING TO THE JUDICIARY," APPROVED MAR
TO AMEND H.R. 7079, APPOINTMENT OF ADDITIONAL DISTRICT AND CIRCUIT JUDGES BY ELIMINATING A NEW JUDGE IN THE SIXTH CIRCUIT.
TO AMEND H.R. 7922, INDEPENDENT OFFICES APPROPRIATIONS, BY REDUCING FROM 6 TO 5 THE NUMBER OF FEDERAL JUDGES IN FLORIDA.

TO AMEND H.R. 7079 BY PROVIDING THAT "AFTER THE DATE OF ENACTMENT OF THIS ACT, THE SALARY OF THE JUDGE OF THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE VIRGIN ISLANDS OF THE UNITED STATES SHALL BE AT THE RATE OF $10.000 A YEAR."
TO PASS H.R. 7079.
TO AMEND H.R. 8668, WAR DEPARTMENT CIVIL FUNCTIONS APPRO- PRIATIONS, BY PROVIDING AN ADDITIONAL APPROPRIATION OF $30,000,000 FOR FLOOD CONTROL IN VARIOUS AREAS.

TO AMEND H.R. 8438, A BILL MAKING NAVAL APPROPRIATIONS, BY INSURING THAT THE MONEY APPROPRIATED FOR NEW AIRPLANES FOR THE NAVY SHOULD BE DEVOTED ENTIRELY TO ACQUIRING NEW AIRPLANES FOR THE NAVY BEFORE THE END OF THE NEXT FISCAL YEAR.
TO PASS H.R. 8438 A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE NAVY DEPARTMENT, FOR 1941.
TO TAKE UP CALENDER 764, A MOTION MADE WHILE SENATE WAS CONSIDERING S. 1296, RECORDING OF AUTOMOBILE LOANS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6264, RIVER AND HARBOR AUTHORIZATIONS, BY AUTHORIZING A WATERWAY CONNECTING THE TOMBIGBEE AND TENNESSEE RIVERS.
TO AMEND H.R. 6264 BY AUTHORIZING THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE UMATILLA DAM ON THE COLUMBIA RIVER.
TO PASS H.R. 6264.
TO AMEND H.R. 9007, DEPARTMENT OF LABOR-FEDERAL SECURITY APPROPRIATIONS, BY REDUCING THE APPROPRIATION FOR C. C. C. CAMPS BY $25,000,000.
TO AMEND H.R. 9007, DEPARTMENT OF LABOR-FEDERAL SECURITY APPROPRIATION, BY INCREASING THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE UNITED STATES FILM SERVICE BY $106,400.
TO OVERRIDE PRESIDENTIAL VETO OF H.R. 289, THE PHILIPPINE TRAVEL-PAY BILL.

TO AMEND S. 785, PROHIBITION OF FOREIGN-SILVER PURCHASES BY PROVIDING THAT NO SILVER SHOULD BE PURCHASED ABROAD UNLESS IT IS AGREED AND ARRANGED SO THAT THE PURCHASE PRICE OF SUCH SILVER SHOULD BE APPLIED SOLELY IN THE PURCHASE AND PAYMENT FOR AGRICULTURL EXPORTS.
TO PASS S. 785, A BILL TO REPEAL THE SILVER PURCHASE ACT OF 1934, AND PROVIDING FOR THE SALE OF SILVER.
TO PASS H.CON.RES. 60, A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION DECLARING THAT THE CONGRESS DOES NOT FAVOR THE REORGANIZATION PLAN NO. IV TRANSMITTED TO CONGRESS BY THE PRESIDENT ON APRIL 11, 1940.

TO AMEND H.R. 9209, A BILL MAKING MILITARY APPROPRIATIONS, BY STRIKING THE FOLLOWING: "TOWARD THE ACQUISITION OF LANDS, AS AUTHORIZED BY THE ACT OF JULY 26, 1939 (53 STAT. 1123), AS FOLLOWS: FORT BLISS, TEX. (ESTIMATED TO COST $800,000), $500,00; FORT MEDE, S

TO AMEND H.R. 9209 BY INSERTING "FOR THE ACQUISITION OF LAND FOR UTAH GENERAL DEPOT, AS AUTHORIZED BY THE ACT OF JULY 2, 1917, AS AMENDED (50 U.S.C. 171), $213,000 TO REMAIN AVAILABLE UNTIL JUNE 30, 1942."

TO AMEND H.R. 9209 BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING; "THAT NO NAVAL AIRCRAFT, THE CONSTRUCTION OF WHICH HAS BEEN OR IS HEREIN AUTHORIZED, SHALL BE RELEASED FOR EXPORT TO ANY FOREIGN NATION UNTIL ONE OF EVERY THREE SUCH AIRCRAFT HEREAFTER PRODUCED SHALL BE DELIVERD TO THE NAVAL AND MILITARY FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES TO BE RETAINED FOR USE IN THE DEFENSE OF THE UNITED STATES, DELIVERIES OF SUCH AIRCRAFT TO BE MADE PURSUANT TO A SCHEDULE TO BE PREPARED BY THE COUNCIL ON NATIONAL DEFENSE."
TO AMEND H.R. 9209 BY APPROPRIATING $100,000 FOR EXPENSES OF THE COUNCIL OF NATIONAL DEFENSE.
TO PASS H.R. 9209.
TO PASS H.R. 8438 A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE NAVY DEPARTMENT AND THE NAVAL SERVICE FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1941.

TO AMEND S. 1970, A BILL TO ELIMINATE OPPRESSIVE LABOR PRACTICES, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING:  "NOTHING IN THIS ACT SHALL PROHIBIT ANY EMPLOYER OF LABOR FROM HIMSELF INVESTI- GATING ANY EMPLOYEE OR PROSPECTIVE EMPLOYEE, OR THROUGH ANOTHER EMPLOYEE (NOT AN AENT OF A STRIKE-BREAKING AGENCY) INVESTIGATING HIS EMPLOYEE OR PROSPECTIVE EMPLOYEE, TO ASCERTAIN THE EMPLOYEE'S COMPETENCY, HIS POLITICAL IDEAS, OR HIS LOYALTY TO AMERICAN IDEALS AND CONCEPTS."
TO PASS S. 1970 A BILL TO ELIMINATE OPPRESSIVE LABOR PRACTICES.
TO PASS H.J.RES. 551, ENABLING REORGANIZATION PLAN NO. V TO TAKE EFFECT.
TO AGREE TO COMFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 9243 A BILL RELATING TO THE ARMY PROMOTION SYSTEM.

TO AMEND S. 4025, EXPEDITION IN STRENGTHENING THE NATIONAL DEFENSE, BY PROVIDING FOR THE CREATION OF A COMMISSION OF FIVE, NOT ONLY TO ADVISE THE PRESIDENT, BUT TO ADMINISTER ANY PLAN FOR INDUSTRIAL MOBILIZATION. THE COMMISSION WAS TO BE APPOINTED BY THEPRESIDENT AND TO HOLD OFFICE AT HIS PLEASURE.

TO AMEND S. 4025 BY LIMITING THE AUTHORIZATION OF THE SECRETARY OF WAR TO PROVIDE FOR THE MANUFUCTURE OF MILITARY EQUIPMENT TO "CRITICAL" SUPPLIES, AND WOULD HAVE PROVIDED FOR THE STORAGE OF "NONCRITICAL" SUPPLIES.

TO AMEND S. 4025 BY REMOVING THE RESTRICTION IN THE EDUCATIONAL-ORDERS  LAW REQUIRING THAT BIDS BE SOLICITED FROM A SELECTED LIST OF THOSE CONSIDERED TO BE QUALIFIED TO RECEIVE SUCH ORDERS.  ALSO, THE AMENDMENT ENABLES THE DEPARTMENT TO DISPOSE OF, BY EXHANGE, DETERIORATED, UNSERVICEABLE, OBSOLESCENT, OR SURPLUS EQUIPMENT, MUNITIONS, AND SUPPLIES FOR OTHER EQUIPMENT, MUNITIONS, AND SUPPLIES.
TO PASS H.R. 9850, EXPEDITION IN STRENGTHENING THE NATIONAL DEFENSE.  AFTER S. 4025, A SENATE BILL OF THE SAME TITLE HAD BEEN AMENDED, IT WAS SUBSTITUTED FOR THE BODY OF H.R. 9850.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 544, APPROPRIATIONS FOR WORK RELIEF AND RELIEF BY GIVING THE PRESIDENT THE AUTHORITY TO AUTHORIZE "ELEMENTARY MILITARY TRAINING" IN C.C.C. CAMPS.
TO AMEND H.J.RES 544 BY PROVIDING THAT THE STATE AGENCIES FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF FEDERAL RELIEF WOULD BE MAINTAINED RATHER THAN A REORGANIZATION INTO REGIONAL DISTRICTS.

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 544 BY INCREASING THE AMOUNT APPROPRIATED FOR W.P.A. BY ABOUT 50 PER CENT FOR THE PURPOSE OF UTILIZING A GREATER NUMBER OF THE UNEMPLOYED WORKERS OF THE COUNTRY IN CONNECTION WITH THE NATIONAL-DEFENSE PROGRAM.  THE AMENDMENT ALSO ESTABLSHES A MAXIMUM OF 5 PER CENT OF THE TOTAL W.P.A

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 544, BY ADDING "THERE IS HEREBY APPROP- RIATED, OUT OF ANY MONEY IN THE TREASURY NOT OTHERWISE APPROPRIATED, FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 1941, THE SUM OF $100,000,000, TO BE USED BY THE SECRETARY OF AGRICULTURE FOR THE PURPOSE OF EFFECTUATING TE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 32 OF THE ACT ENTITLED 'AN ACT TO AMEND THE AGRICULTURAL ADJUSTMENT ACT, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES,' APPROVED AUGUST 24, 1935, AS AMENDED, SUCH SUM TO BE IN ADDITION TO ANY FUNDS APPROPRIATED BY SUCH SECTION 32."

TO AMEND H.J.RES. 544 BY STRIKING THE FOLLOWING "NO LOAN OR GRANT SHALL BE MADE UNDER THIS SECTION TO ANY PERSON TO ENABLE HIM TO SUBSCRIBE OR PAY FOR STOCK OR MEMBERSHIP IN ANY COOPERATIVE ASSOCIATION."  THIS PROVISION WAS ESPECIALLY IMPORTANT IN THE REABILITATION EFFORTS OF THE FARM SECURITY ADMINISTRATION.
TO AMEND H.J.RES. 544 BY STRIKING THE 18 MONTH TIME LIMIT FOR THE RECIPIENTS OF WORK RELIEF.
TO AMEND H.R. 10039, REVENUE BILL OF 1940, BY INCREASING THE TAX ON RECTIFIED WHISKY FROM 30 CENTS TO 40 CENTS A GALLON.

TO PASS H.J.RES. 271 A JOINT RESOLUTION APPROVING NONRE- COGNITION OF THE TRANSFER OF ANY GEOGRAPHIC REGION IN THE WESTERN HEMISPHERE FROM ONE NON NON-AMERICAN POWER TO ANOTHER NON-AMERICAN POWER, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSULTATION WITH OTHER AMERICAN REPUBLCS IN THE EVENT THAT SUCH TRANSFER SHOULD APPEAR LIKELY.
TO AMEND H.R. 10039, REVENUE BILL OF 1940, BY PROHIBITING THE PURCHASE BY THE GOVERNMENT OF FOREIGN SILVER.
TO AMEND H.R. 10039 BY STRIKING THE WORDS "AND DIRECTED" FROM A PROVISION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO REDUCE EXPENDITURES IN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH OF GOVERNMENT BY 10 PER CENT.
TO AMEND H.R. 10039 BY AUTHORIZING AND DIRECTING THE PRESIDENT TO REDUCE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH OF THE GOVERNMENT BY 5 PER CENT.

TO AMEND H.R. 10039 BY PROVIDING THAT "THE COMMITTEES ON APPROPRIATIONS OF THE SENATE AND HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES ARE HEREBY DIRECTED TO REVIEW THE APPROPRIATION BILLS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1941, AND TO REPORT ON OR BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1, 194, SUCH AMENDMENTS THERETO AS WILL EFFECT A TOTAL REDUCTION OF $500,000,000 IN THE CIVIL EXPENSE OF THE GOVERNMENT WITHOUT IMPAIRING EFFICIENCY."
TO AMEND H.R. 10039 BY DIRECTING THE PRESIDENT TO REDUCE THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH OF THE GOVERN- MENT BY NOT LESS THAN 4 PER CENT.
TO AMEND H.R. 10039 BY AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO REDUCE EXPENDITURES IN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH OF THE GOVERNMENT BY 10 PER CENT.
TO AMEND H.R. 10039 BY PROHIBITING ANY RETROACTIVE TAXATION OF STATE EMPLOYEES ENGAGED BY UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE TAXATION LAW PASSED ON APRIL 12, 1939.

TO AMEND H.R. 10039 BY IMPOSING AN EXCESS-PROFITS TAX ON CORPORATIONS BASED ON INVESTED CAPITAL FOR 1940 AND SUBSEQUENT YEARS.  BEFORE THE TAX APPLIES TO THE CORPORA- TION IT MUST HAVE NET INCOME IN EXCESS OF $3,000 PLUS 8 PER CENT OF ITS INVESTED CAPITA FOR THE TAXABLE YEAR.
TO AMEND H.R. 10039 BY INSERTING AS AN AMENDMENT THE TEXT OF SENATE BILL 4141.
TO PASS H.R. 10039.

TO OVERRIDE VETO OF H.R. 9381, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE ALTERATION OF CERTAIN BRIDGES OVER NAVIGABLE WATERS OF THE UNITES STATES AND FOR THE APPORTIONMENT OF THE COST OF SUCH ALTERATIONS BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE OWNERS OF SUCH BRIDGES.
TO AGREE CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 10039, THE REVENUE BILL OF 1940.
CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF HENRY L. STIMSON TO BE SECRETARY OF WAR.
CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF FRANK KNOX TO BE SECRETARY OF THE NAVY.

TO AMEND S.J.RES. 286, ACTIVE SERVICE OF NATIONAL GUARD, RESERVE, AND RETIRED PERSONNEL, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING: "ANY PERSON NOW SUBJECT TO THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 1 (AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO ORDER INTO THE ACTIVE MILITARY SERVICE OF THE UNITED STTES FOR A PERIOD OF 12 CONSECUTIVE MONTHS ANY OR ALL MEMBERS AND UNITS OF ANY OR ALL RESERVE COMPONENTS OF THE ARMY OF THE UNITED STATES, AND RETIRED PERSONNEL OF THE REGULAR ARMY, WITH OR WITHOUT THEIR CONSENT.)  MAY RESIGN HIS STATUS WITHIN 20 DAYS AFTE...

TO AMEND S.J.RES. 286, BY LIMITING THE SERVICE OF THE MEN BROUGHT INTO THE NATIONAL SERVICE BY THIS ACT TO THE CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES AND OTHER TERRITORIES AND POSSESSIONS OF THE UNITED STATES RATHER THAN TO THE "WESTERN HEMISPHERE."

TO RECOMMIT S.J.RES. 286 TO THE COMMITTEE ON MILITARY AFFAIRS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO LIMIT THE SERVICE OF MEN CONSCRIPTED UNDER THIS ACT TO THE "CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES AND TERRITORIES AND POSSESSIONS OF THE UNITED STATES."
TO PASS S.J.RES. 286, AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO ORDER MEMBERS AND UNITS OF RESERVE COMPONENTS AND RETIRED PERSONNEL OF THE REGULAR ARMY INTO ACTIVE MILITARY SERVICE.

TO AMEND S. 4164, SELECTIVE "COMPULSORY MILITARY SERVICE, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING: "REGULAR OR DULY ORDAINED MINISTERS OF RELIGION AND STUDENTS, WHO ARE PREPARING FOR THE MINISTRY IN THEOLOGICAL OR DIVINITY SCHOOLS RECOGNIZED AS SUCH FOR MORE THAN 1 YEARPRIOR TO THE DATE OF ENACTMENT OF THIS ACT, SHALL BE EXEMPT FROM TRAINING AND SERVICE (BUT NOT FROM REGISTRATION) UNDER THIS ACT."

TO DECIDE A POINT OF ORDER RAISED AGAINST AN AMENDMENT TO S.4164 WHICH WOULD HAVE AUTHORIZED THE PRESIDENT IN A NATIONAL EMERGENCY TO "DRAFT CAPITAL."  IT WAS ARGUED THAT THIS WAS A REVENUE MEASURE WHICH MUST ORIGINATE IN THE HOUSE.
TO AMEND S. 4164 BY REDUCING THE AGE RANGE WITHIN WHICH SELECTIONS ARE TO BE MADE FROM THE RANGE OF 21 TO 31 IN THE BILL, TO THE RANGE OF 21 TO 25.
TO AMEND S. 4164 BY PROHIBITING DISCRIMINATION WITH REGARD TO RACE, CREED, OR COLOR.  THIS AMENDMENT DEALS WITH THE ENLISTMENT SECTION OF THE LAW.

TO AMEND S. 4164 BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING:  "PERSONS INDUCTED INTO THE LAND OR NAVAL FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES FOR TRAINING AND SERVICE UNDER THIS ACT SHALL NOT IN TIMES OF PEACE BE EMPLOYED BEYOND THE LIMITS OF THE CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES AND THE TERITORIES AND POSSESSIONS OF THE UNITED STATES."

TO AMEND S. 4164 BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING:  "PERSONS INDUCTED INTO THE LAND FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES PURSUANT TO THIS ACT SHALL NOT BE EMPLOYED BEYOND THE LIMITS OF THE WESTERN HEMISPHERE EXCEPT IN THE TERRITORIES AND POSSESSIONS OF THE UNITED STATES, NCLUDING THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS."

TO AMEND S. 4164 BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING:  "THAT NO PERSON SHALL BE INDUCTED INTO THE LAND OR NAVAL FORCES OF THE UNITED STATES UNDER THIS ACT, EXCEPT PURSUANT TO VOLUNTARY INLISTMENT, UNLESS AND UNTIL THE CONGRESS SHALL HAVE DECLARED THAT A STATE OF WAREXISTS, OR HAS DECLARED THAT UNITED STATES IS THREATENED WITH INVASION."
TO AMEND S. 4164 BY SUBSTITUTING A VOLUNTARY SYSTEM OF MILITARY TRAINING IN LIEU OF THE COMPULSORY SYSTEM UNDER THE ACT.
TO AMEND S. 4164 BY PROHIBITING THE PRESIDENT FROM INDUCTING PERSONS UNDER THIS ACT UNTIL THE CONGRESS DECLARES A NATIONAL EMERGENCY.

TO AMEND S. 4164 BY STRIKING THE PROVISO WHICH PERMITS THE SECRETARY OF THE NAVY TO FIX THE COMPENSATION OF THE OWNER OF THE PLANT, PROVIDES FOR THE INSTITUTION OF CONDEMNATION PROCEEDINGS UNDER EXISTING LAW, AND GIVES THE SECRETARY OF WAR IN THE CASE OFWAR DEPARTMENT CONTRACTS THE RIGHT TO ENTER INTO POSSESSION OF THE PROPERTY UPON THE FILING OF THE CONDEMNATION PROCEEDINGS.

TO AMEND S. 4164 BY GIVING THE PRESIDENT THE AUTHORITY IMMEDIATELY UPON THE PASSAGE OF S. 4164 TO ISSUE A CALL FOR 400,000 VOLUNTEERS.  CALLS FOR 400,000 VOLUNTEERS WOULD ALSO BE ISSUED ON JANUARY 1, 1941 AND APRIL 1, 1941, AND THE DRAFT WOULD NOT GO INT EFFECT AS LONG AS THE CALLS FOR VOLUNTEERS WERE MET.

TO AMEND S. 4164 BY PROVIDING FOR A SYSTEM OF VOLUNTARY ENLISTMENT BASED ON AN ORIGINAL PERIOD OF 30 DAYS AND THEN SUCCESSIVE PERIODS OF 10 DAYS UNTIL VOLUNTARY ENLISTMENTS HAD FAILED TO FILL THE SERVICE REQUIREMENTS.  ONLY AFTER THE VOLUNTARY ENLISTMENT HAD PROVED INADEQUATE WOULD THE COMPULSORY DRAFT BE USED.
TO AMEND S. 4164 BY DEFERRING CONSCRIPTION UNTIL JANUARY 1, 1941, WHILE A CAMPAIGN FOR VOLUNTEERS PROCEEDS UNDER PRESIDENTIAL PROCLAMATION.
TO PASS S. 4164.
TO DECIDE A POINT OF ORDER CONCERNING THE QUESTION OF WHETHER THE CONDERENCE COMMITTEE HAD EXCEEDED ITS AUTHORITY IN MODIFYING S. 2009, A BILL RELATING TO THE REGULATION OF INTERSTATE CARRIERS.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 2009, A BILL RELATING TO THE REGULATION OF INTERSTATE CARRIERS.

TO INSTRUCT THE SENATE CONFEREES UPON S. 4164, SELECTIVE COMPULSORY MILITARY SERVICE BILL, (1) NOT TO AGREE TO ANY CHANGE IN THE PROVISION OF THE BILL AS IT PASSED THE SENATE FIXING THE AGES OF REGISTRATION AT 21 TO 31 INCLUSIVE.
TO INSTRUCT THE SENATE CONFEREES S. 4164:9.. (2) TO AGREE WITH THE PROVISION OF THE HOUSE BILL KNOWN AS THE FISH AMENDMENT PROVIDING FOR A POSTPONEMENT OF THE REGISTRATION FOR 60 DAYS.

TO AMEND S. 4204, EXPANSION OF LENDING AUTHORITY OF EXPORT-IMPORT BANK, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING "SUCH LOANS SHALL ONLY BE MADE FOR THE PURPOSE OF ASSISTING IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF RESOURCES WHICH ARE DEFINED BY THE PRESIDENT AS STRATEGIC AND CRITICAL MATERALS OR OF RESOURCES AND MATERIALS WHICH ARE NOT PRODUCED IN THE UNITED STATES IN APPRECIABLE QUANTITIES AND WHICH ARE REQUIRED FOR USE IN THE UNITED STATES."

TO AMEND S. 4204, BY ADDING THE FOLLOWING "THAT THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT OF LOANS TO ANY ONE FOREIGN COUNTRY AND THE AGENCIES AND NATIONALS THEREOF WHICH ARE HEREAFTER AUTHORIZED TO BE MADE AND ARE OUTSTANDING AT ANY ONE TIME SHALL NOT EXCEED $50,000,000, AN SUCH AMOUNT SHALL BE IN ADDITION TO THE AMOUNT OF LOANS HERETOFORE AUTHORIZED OR MADE TO SUCH FOREIGN COUNTRY AND THE AGENCIES AND NATIONALS THEREOF."

TO PASS H.R. 10361, EXPANSION OF LENDING AUTHORITY OF EXPORT-IMPORT BANK, PROVIDING FOR INCREASING THE LENDING AUTHORITY OF THE EXPORT-IMPORT BANK OF WASHINGTON. (AFTER S. 4204 WAS AMENDED, IT WAS SUBSTITUTED FOR THE BODY OF H.R. 10361.)

CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 4164 COMPULSORY SELECTIVE MILITARY SERVICE, TO RECOMMIT S. 4164 TO THE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTION TO THE CONFEREES ON THE PART OF THE SENATE TO ACCEPT (AND, IF NECESSARY, TO INSIST UPON SUCH ACCEP- TANCE), IN LIEU OF TH LANGUAGE CONTAINED IN SECTION 9 OF THE CONFERENCE REPORT (RELATING TO THE TAKING OVER OF MANUFACTURING PLANTS BY THE PRESIDENT), THE LANGUAGE CONTAINED IN SECTION 12 OF THE HOUSE AMENDMENT, AND THAT THEY REPORT BACK TO THE SENATE AT THE EARLIEST PRACTICA...
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 4164.

TO AMEND H.R. 10413, CORPORATION INCOME AND EXCESS-PROFITS TAXATION, BY APPLYING THE PRINCIPLES OF PROGRESSSIVE TAXATION TO THE CORPORATE TAX LAW AND PLACING A LARGER BURDEN ON THE WEALTHIER CORPORATION.

TO AMEND H.R. 10413 BY PREVENTING (1) ANY FURTHER ISSUE OF TAXEXEMPT BONDS BY THE FEDERAL OR STATE GOVERNMENTS; (2) PERMITTING FULL INCOME TAXATION, ON THE SAME BASIS AS OTHER BONDS ARE EAXED, BY ALL THE STATES OF THE UNION; (3) PERMITTING THE REFUNDING F ANY PRESENT OUTSTANDING BONDS WHEN IT IS DESIRABLE FROM THE STANDPOINT OF THE MUNICIPALITY, THE STATE, OR THE BOND-ISSUING AUTHORITY TO DO SO IN ORDER TO GET A LOWER RATE OF INTEREST OR BETTER TERMS, PROVIDED THE MATURITY DATES OF THE BONDS ARE NOT EXTE...
TO PASS H.R. 10413.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 3550 A BILL TO MAKE UNLAWFUL THE TRANSPORTATION OF CONVICT-MADE GOODS IN INTERSTATE AND FOREIGN COMMERCE.
TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON H.R. 10361, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR INCREASING THE LENDING AUTHORITY OF THE EXPORT-IMPORT BANK OF WASHINGTON.
TO CONSIDER H.R. 960, A BILL EXTENDING THE CLASSIFIED CIVIL SERVICE.
TO TABLE A MOTION TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH AN AMENDMENT LIMITING THE COVERAGE OF THE BILL, H.R. 960, WAS PASSED.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH AN AMENDMENT PROPOSED BY SENATOR ELLENDER LIMITING THE COVERAGE OF THE BILL, H.R. 960, WAS PASSED.

TO AMEND H.R. 960 BY REQUIRING THE HOLDING OF WIDE-OPEN PUBLIC COMPETITIVE CIVIL-SERVICE EXAMINATIONS FOR ALL THE POSITIONS IN ALL THE CATEGORIES THAT ARE TO BE FILLED WHEN THE VARIOUS AGENCIES ARE TAKEN OVER BY PROCLAMATION AND BROUGHT WITHIN THE MERIT YSTEM.

TO AGREE TO CONFERENCE REPORT ON S. 162 A BILL TO PROTECT PRODUCERS, MANUFACTURERS, DISTRIBUTORS, AND CONSUMERS FROM THE UNREVEALED PRESENCE OF SUBSTITUTES AND MIXTURES IN SPUN, WOVEN, KNITTED, FELTED, OR OTHERWISE MANUFACTURED WOOL PRODUCTS.
CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF FRANK S. PERKINS TO BE POSTMASTER AT FREMONT, NEBRASKA.
TO REFRAIN FROM CONSIDERATION OF S. 1681, RELATING TO MOUNTAIN JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF TENNESSEE, IN THE ABSENCE OF SENATOR REED WHO HAD LED THE OPPOSITION TO THE BILL.
TO CONSIDER H.R. 6324, A BILL RELATING TO THE REGULATION OF ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEDURE, PROVIDING FOR THE MORE EXPEDITIOUS SETTLEMENT OF DISPUTES WITH THE UNITED STATES, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
TO PASS H.R. 6324, RELATING TO THE REGULATION OF ADMINIS- TRATIVE PROCEDURE, PROVIDING FOR THE MORE EXPEDITIOUS SETTLEMENT OF DISPUTES WITH THE UNITED STATES.
CONFIRMATION OF THE NOMINATION OF MR. JOSEPH WARREN MADDEN TO BE A MEMBER OF THE COURT OF CLAIMS.
